noun.description: A long, thin line or mark of a different substance or color from its surroundings.
An element of a specified kind in someone's character.
examples: there's a streak of insanity in the family
tears streaking her face, Cynthia looked up
his beard was streaked with gray

verb.description: Move very fast in a specified direction.
examples: the cat leaped free and streaked across the street

verb.description: Run naked in a public place so as to shock or amuse others.

phrases: he is off like a streak
Suddenly she took off, like a streak, straight ahead, and vanished out of sight.
The shark would probably be off like a streak if he saw a man diving toward him.
Of all the fish Charlie is always the first to spot your approach, crossing the pool like a streak of greased lightning to stick his head out of the water.
Then he was off like a streak, running up the hill.
origin: Old English strica, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch streek and German Strich, also to strike. The sense run naked was originally US slang.
